comment: She is honest and upfront about what she expects. Her classes rely on participation but if you are a marketing major she is really helpful because she forces you to retain the information. She has a passion for marketing and has a very "old school" way of thinking which I believe causes her to clash with students.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: If you're deciding on taking Professor Stuart and not taking the class at all, don't take the class. There are 3 tests, participation, and a semester-long group project with unassigned groups. She grades tough for a principal's class, and her feedback if any, is basically illegible.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Honestly she is a really good professor. On a personal basis she is kind of rude and passive agressive and WILL embarrass you in front of the class if you miss a question/ offend her. She does say you need to buy a text book but I never did, she mostly tests on past lectures but she does NOT upload any lectures/power points.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Test heavy

comment: She is really rude but honestly I've learned so much about marketing I'm so conflicted. As a person she is not very kind and is super strict with everything. She counts participation but is super passive aggressive if you do not answer correctly. I think she has a very tough teaching style but in a way in forces you to learn.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Professor is clearly a seasoned professional, she knows the industry and has a clear understanding of the course concepts. It seems like she has been teaching the course the same way for years. 3 tests and a group project, attendance is mandatory. Don't miss her lecture on the essay portion of the exam as that will make or break your test grades.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: The worst professor I have had during my time at KSU. Avoid this professor at all costs, while the content may be easy the professor is rude and a very tough grader. Would not suggest this professor even as a last resort.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: She's not the nicest but not too bad but go with another prof if you can
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment:
Cons: Quite rude to students, and toughest grader I've had so far. Would knock points off your essay questions on the exam if you worded your answer slightly differently from what she wanted. 
Pros: She does treat you like an adult. As an older student, I could see much of what she was trying to teach was similar to what "the real world" expects.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: 3 tests and a group project. P. You HAVE to go to class, participate, find a good group early, and work on it early. Tests are straightforward. Essay question answered are basically given to you in class. Project grading criteria is INSANE. An A project is a B- in her eyes. It's doable but 10/10 would not take her again.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Professor Stuart is knowledgeable in her craft and you WILL learn a lot in this class, her presentation is engaging and interesting and if you participate in class you will do well. She is sometimes harsh with students, but she is challenging them to do their best. The tests are pretty brutal, I'm an "A" student, I was struggling to get above 90%
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Do not take her. She is rude. She grades hard. You only have 3 hard exams and a group project that she grades heavy on. She made it impossible to like her class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy

comment: Do not take this professor! She has an unreasonably rude attitude which makes her beyond unprofessional. If she doesn't like you, good luck with that; she gets annoyed easily by questions. She played with the rubric of the group project, and then after we asked her, she changed our grade, which made the whole grading process shady.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters

comment: DO NOT take this professor. She is VERY RUDE. She gets anoyyed easily by simple questions and if she doesn't like you, good luck! She has an unreasonable attitude which makes her beyond unprofessional. She plays with the rubric when grading which makes the whole grading system look shady.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters

comment: Do not take this teacher, she is so strict on attendance and does not care if you miss class due to a health issue. Had to withdraw this class and luckily its not part of my major.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Unreasonably difficult for a 3100 course

You 100% have to be at lectures or get notes from someone else or you will NOT pass the tests. She's very particular about how you answer test questions because her lectures will differ from what the textbook/google says a lot. She's not as bad as RMP makes her out to be, she can poke fun at students but it's never malicious.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Stuart has a very distinct teaching style that directly reflects her personality. She is short and can come off as very rude but if you get to know her, that's not the case. Don't take her if your feelings are easily hurt. 3 tests each with 35 multiple choice questions and 3 essay questions that need to be memorized word for word. 1 group project.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: terrible at grading. each of the 3 exams has 3 essays as well as multiple choice. all exams are done in class. project is presented and thoroughly graded.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Gradebook: 3 tests, 1 group project, participation. DO NOT FORGET YOUR ORANGE CARD. tests are in person with scantron, 35 multiple choice 3 essays. Speak up in class for credit. In class she does hint on what's on the test. There is a text book but its not necessarily required, just study your notes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: Typically, I appreciate challenging professors as they tend to be passionate and care about there students. However, Prof. Stuart consistently carried a self-righteous, demeaning attitude. The grading always seemed irrational and based on her own un-structured opinion. Her lectures taught me a lot BUT impossible to turn that into a decent grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: I have had a lot of profs, but she might be the worst one ive had. Her lectures are hard to follow, especially as a student with ADD. Her lecturing pacing is odd and she uses a lot of charts, which is fine and important to the course. But theyre hard to copy when youre taking notes on a computer and cant draw the chart out.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: teaches well, i actually retained information for tests and the group project. but she is rude lol she expects u to act like an adult, participation is required and counts against your grade, there are stupid questions in her mind so makes it intimidating to speak up. but just go to class, take good notes, tests=essay and multiple choice, 1 project
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: She is great at helping when you ask. She expect you act like a responsible adult.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Accessible outside class

comment: I am just going to be honest here. This teacher is insanely rude, disrespectful and overall, just an ass.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters

comment: Not only is attendance mandatory, but participation is graded too. There are 3 tests, which require you to also write 3 short essays that she grades VERY harshly. I wouldn't be surprised if Stuart was the hardest professor for this class. Would not take again.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: Very difficult professor for an introduction class. Grades are only based on 3 tests, 1 term project and class attendance points. Extremely rude to students who asks questions. Tests are multiple choice and you have to write 3 essays out of the 4 given. SHE IS A VERY TOUGH GRADER!!!!!! Be prepared to feel stupid when asking questions.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
Uninteresting, monotone, grumpy and rude. Very easy to snooze if it weren't for the fact that everything on the tests is drawn directly from the notes you take in class and no notes or PowerPoints will be given online AND you need to participate thoroughly with plenty of interaction every class to get a perfect attendance score. 

Pick someone else
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters

comment: If you want to have the worst educational experience of your life, take this professor. She has a bad attitude for no reason. Exams are unnecessarily hard. Essay questions that require full page answers each. Does not upload lectures, miss class  wont know what the exam is on. ***She wants to prove you wrong more than she wants you to be right***
This is marketing 3100 and she makes it way harder than it needs to be. You have essays that she grades harsh. Id 100% take someone else
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Her tests are idiotic. She has essay questions with each exam on top of multiple choice and you have to write on three topics for a total of 30pts per exam. She grades them hard for no reason, all up to her judgment. I would use exactly what the notes had and she would still give a crappy grade. Shes horrible, do not take.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Shes a great professor! you must go to class and participate so you can get the notes and attendance credit. the exams are exactly whats in the notes from lecture and she tells you what you need to study for the written portion of exam. just as long as you use the study guide youll pass the test!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: I never thought I'd see myself doing one of these. This is by far the worst instructor I've experienced at KSU. There are 3 very difficult tests and a project that she purposely unjustly grades. There is a written portion of the test which turns it from right or wrong answers to a subjective opinion based on what you write and what she thinks.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: This is the type of teacher that makes you want to drop out, do not take this professor. Not even just how she teaches, but how she is as a person. For example, She spilled water on a kids laptop and blamed him for. You have 3 essays with each test and have little time and she grades the test ridiculously hard for no reason. Shes awful man.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Definitely one of my favorite professors I have ever taken. She knows what she is talking about. The people who are complaining aren't studying or taking good notes. The lectures are interesting. The test are directly from the notes. Essay questions are easy if you write what she says in class. If you study, it's an easy A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Amazing lectures

comment: She was my favorite professor Ive had at kennesaw ! If you have anything bad to say about her test, you arent studying enough. All you have to do is study your class notes and read the text book and you can make an A. Multiple choice section is easy and written questions are word for word from notes. Ive actually learned from her class.

I'm not going to repeat what others have said on here, but there is a level of truth to the comments made. She's aware of the feedback she gets on evals. and clearly implied she doesn't care, i'd say wait till add-drop to see if you get the patience to have an online section if you need an A. She's the only prof. that grades off tests/proj. only.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Worst professor Ive ever taken. Making an easy class hard is not a brag. Shes rude and condescending towards student for asking questions. Only information she provides are lectures but loses her train of thought often and ummms for at least half the class. The group project is a huge portion of your grade but heavily depends on others. AVOID
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I am a marketing major and she totally has me questioning it as this was my first marketing class and finished with a C. Bottom line is, SHE MAKES YOU FEEL DUMB. Even with Covid going on, she was not empathetic at all and have to go to class if you want the notes. Picky grader, even if you write exactly what she says she doesnt like it. AVOID

She is the worst professor I have ever taken. She treats her students like they are in preschool and she acts like she knows everything. DO NOT TAKE HER. She does not give A's. She does not post her notes and participation is a big percentage of your grade. If you are a marketing major this class will make you hate marketing.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: This class was comprised of 3 exams, 1 group project, and participation points. She is really knowledgeable in Marketing, and you have to make sure you go to her classes to do well. If you put forth the effort, you will make a B. Do even better, and youll make an A. She treats us as adults, and she prepares us for whats ahead in our careers.

comment: Doesnt post powerpoints or anything helpful. Essay questions are impossible to get perfect on. Three tests and a group project. Classes are lecture heavy.

comment: Way harder class than it needs to be, tests have essays that are all memorization, group project and she grades insanely hard. dont take if you dont want to work your ass off
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: As a marketing major, I was excited to get more into detail with my major in this class. comment: Honestly I dont know how this professor is still teaching. Shes beyond rude and you can tell she isnt passionate about the content or students. comment: Not my favorite professor. Graded the essay portion of the tests very harshly. She is very by-the-book. 3 tough tests and a long group presentation and paper. Meh
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Very hard class. She made me want to switch my major, which is marketing. There are three exams and a group project. All the exams have essay questions and you can never get a perfect score on it. You have to write word for word what she says in class or you get points of. She does not post notes even with COVID. Participation is a grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Very condescending. She asks questions in lectures and expects answers but when she finally hears you it's usually wrong. If you miss a class you will fail. comment: Worst professor I have taken at KSU. I withdrew because it was not worth failing her class. Do not recommend at all!!!

comment: GPA dropped just as hard as my will to continue this major.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: This teacher honestly scared me in the beginning with fast catlike reflexes and super built and intimidating! She disliked all of my well-thought answers and ideas
I would rather be injected with a continuous dose of Ecoli and live on the toilet for the rest of my life than take her again. It was the worst learning experience I've ever had and do not recommend
AVOID. DO NOT TAKE. WORST PROFESSOR AT KSU

DO NOT take her. Ridiculously Nit-picky. I am confident I understood all material for the first exam thoroughly, and still made a C on the first exam. She took off points in essays for really strange things, almost like she was just trying to find anything to knock off points. It is not worth taking the risk with her. Find someone else.
Professor Stuart is a good option for marketing. She is a pretty tough grader, but she gives great notes. The class isn't that difficult so she's a good middle of the line choice

Her tests has short answer on them that she gives you the exact answer to but you have to memorize them and copy them EXACTLY on the test to get a 100. If you miss one word it cuts your grade back. rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Overall was a decent professor. Was very knowledgeable about the material and gave practical examples that made the material stick. rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: There is nothing wrong with this class itself. Textbook not required, don't skip class because notes aren't posted. Make sure to take really good notes, write down everything she says. rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Everyday its all lectures and boring ones at that gives snarky remarks if you dont know a question and the test are nothing like what she teaches i had 10 pages of nites before test one and thought i had it down and failed badly. comment: Worst professor I have had from my 4 years at KSU. Incredibly rude. Makes fun of students for asking questions and belittles them in front of everyone. comment: Worst professor Ive ever taken! Theres just no way to do well on the essay part of the exam which covers most of the grade
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: 3 tests and 1 group project. Not sure what she wanted for the essay questions on the test because I just could not get an A on the tests (lowest was 85). comment: She is a careless/heartless TEACHER that does not care if you actually learn anything. she is terrible, WOULD NOT TAKE HER AS A PROFESSOR!!!!!!!!!!

comment: You will get whatever grade she WANTS you to have in the class. Her personality can clash with many people. Avoid if you can.

comment: She without a doubt is the RUDEST teacher I've ever had at KSU in my 4 years here. I was shocked of how rude and disrespectful she was to everyone. She makes everything 10x harder than they need to be and is an extremely tough grader. I WOULD STAY FAR AWAY FROM ANY OF HER CLASSES.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Stuart is a crabby person. She does not want people to do well and makes tests extremely difficult. If you are good at memorizing essays verbatim what she speaks in class, then you may do okay. Other than that, I would never recommend her unless you want to tank your GPA.

This was without a doubt the WORST professor I have ever had. Not only was she the most disrespectful and rudest person I have ever met, her class was also very difficult for me. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS!!!!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: worst teacher I've ever had!!!! she is so incredibly rude, she has the WORST attitude every single class, and is a horrible professor!!!! DO NOT TAKE!!!
rating_tags: Group projects--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Group project is graded harshly. Spends no less than 20 minutes each lecture silent, trying to think of what to say next. Greatly irritating. Marketing isn't a difficult subject, but this professor makes it so dull that it becomes very difficult to pay attention. I highly recommend avoiding this professor if possible. Very condescending.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Are you sure you want to do this to yourself? Do you want a professor who advises you to read the textbook but if it doesnt say exactly what she wants it to say she tells you to go with her made up definition instead? Do you want a professor who addresses students in class in an extremely rude and distasteful manner? Please, review your options.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Stuart has the worst attitude and its time for her to retire. Shes very disrespectful and she doesn't care about her students. She loves to be right , so good luck trying to convince her otherwise. I can say she has great knowledge on marketing, but because shes miserable she makes everyone suffer. I wish her happiness in her life!

Class is a 500pt scale. 60% of your entire grade is decided in the last 2 weeks. 68% of that is based on her sole discretion. Grading is VERY subjective. She decides 53% of your grade(265pts total is her opinion on tests, participation, and project.) She hands you a rubric for your project AFTER it's been graded. Grading never favored the student.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: She is terribly rude when it comes to anything that differs from her view point. She doesn't post anything online other than the test study guides. She gives you the essay questions in class but you have to repeat them back word for word to get a good grade on the essay portion. Attendance is mandatory and you have to grade yourself like a child.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I once wrote on her class feedback that I did not understand how such an unapproachable person could be a marketing professor. She is rude and looks at you like you're stupid. She also gets offended by the word "church" and makes you say "place of worship" instead. I'm a marketing student and she made it 10x harder than it had to be.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: This class is an easier than average "B" and harder than average "A." The group project (30% of overall grade) provides little rubric, the essays on tests need to be regurgitated back to her exactly (tests are 65%), and class participation(5%) involves you scoring yourself like a pre-schooler. Overall, uninformative and mind-numbing, easy B.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Do NOT take this professor! Not only is she unbelievably rude, she's an incredibly tough grader. Hardly anything she goes over in class in on the test. There's a semester long group project, but no matter how hard you work, you won't get a good grade on it. STAY AWAY!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: I liked Dr Stuart. She encouraged discussion by making daily participation mandatory and gave examples to any new ideas that she would present to us. You will be graded mostly on the three tests and the group project. My only complaint is that I feel that she was a very tough grader when it came to the essay portion of the exams.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: She can be tough sometimes, but this was an enjoyable class. She's very knowledgable about the ins and outs of marketing and I felt like I learned many things in this class that I could take with me in my career. Class wise, there are 3 tests with multiple choice and essay questions and a big group project as well. I'd highly recommend this class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Respected--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Stuart is an extremely tough grader. She grades things like public speaking skills and the Microsoft platform when you present your final project. She is one of those professors who students are afraid of asking questions because shes pretty harsh if its something she considers a dumb question. However, she is a good professor.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I really enjoyed this class. She has a very tough personality and will NOT hesitate to tell you that you are wrong. For the test, there are 2 parts writing and multiple choice. For the writing portion, write down exactly want she says, and memorize it. GO TO CLASS AND PARTICIPATE!
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Do not fear. Professor Stuart is a great professor who knows what she teaches and makes the class very engage with each other. There are two essay question on every test however she gives them to you in class and as long as you practice writing them out you'll be fine. Her test questions make you think and apply terms in scenarios. Group project.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I love Ms Stuart!!! Go to class and take really good notes. Never used the book. Participation matters some, so you have to go to class. Tests are multiple choice and 3 "essay" questions, which she gives ahead of time. She is so knowledgeable about marketing, and gives real definitions/examples during lectures, not just boring textbook info.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Stuart is a master of the material, but an extremely tough grader. Her "B" is everyone elses "A" and her "C" is everyone elses "B" and so on. You MUST go to class. One semester group project that isn't awful. An A is hard to obtain even with studying very hard, but a B is very very realistic.

DO NOT TAKE HER. She gives you these score cards basically and you have to pick a number based on how well you think you participated that day, don't lie she checks them after class. In-class quizzes were difficult but mostly vocab based (not my forte). First test was so bad I had to drop the class. She is very rude and gives 0 exceptions.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Hard grader & the class is only out of 500, so make sure you score high on exams. I did not need the book, I used her notes from class to score 80s and above on exams. The notecards for attendance and participation is annoying.. she graded leniently imo. Pick a great group for the group project & start early!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very rude to students, calls out people in class, uses name tags, attendance is mandatory, grades essays very tough
rating_tags: Tough Grader

comment: Ms. Stuart gives concise expectations. Test are 2 parts, essay & multiple choice. She gives you a heads up on what will be the essay questions & you choose 3 out of 4 to answer. Multiple choice can be tricky, she provides a review sheet, if you study the material & take good notes, she provides ample time to do so, you will get a good grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: In the past 4 years I have been in college I have never blatantly dreaded a class as much as I have Professor Stuarts. I was anxious and sick before her class every day. No matter how hard I worked it was never enough. She spends 90% of the class asking questions for class participation and ridicules you if you get them wrong. Do not take her.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Take really good notes!  Powerpoints in class isn't accessible online.  Study notes for exam.  Gives review sheet before exams.  Test lasts two days, 1 day for the multiple choice, the other is the essay.  Group project is big as well.  She is certainly a tough grader but it is manageable.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Go Cubs! and she will love you! strict, but forward. Essay tests and multiple choice. Tests are split on two days. Group project. Keep up, or you will be lost.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: three tests all semester, large group project. takes attendance and rates your participation daily. attendance/participation  is 25% of your grade! impossible to make an A on the essay portions of the test. Super picky with her work. Nothing is good enough. Ppts are not online. MUST go to class. But she is personable and funny
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She's a cool teacher but she's probably one of the most strict teachers I've ever had. Essay part of the tests are impossible to get an A on because they are never perfect for her. Cool with her students, but the strictness of grading pissed me off the whole semester
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Best teacher I've had. She's fair with grading and tells you everything you need to know for the tests. The tests are easy too, just show up to class and pay attention to the power points and you'll get a good grade. There are no quizzes or HW. There are 3 exams and a group project.  Ps, Dont let her intimidate you, she's not that strict or mean.

Her tests consist of 35 MC questions and 3 essays all in one session, which can be very intense so be warned. She grades extremely hard on the group projects so go into crazy detail on it. You rate yourself on your participation which can be annoying but it makes a difference for your grade. Overall her class was a huge headache.

Offers a study guide &"heads up" on essay questions. Showing up & taking detailed notes is best way to pass. Everything she wants for tests comes directly from the lectures. The essays can be tough, but good notes wexamples go a long way. She is helpful if you ask the right question.  Not as mean as everyone makes her out to be, unless your lazy.

Stuart is a very good professor, and I learned a lot in her class. She has a "tough persona" however, I'm pretty sure it's for show because she seems to really care about how her students fare.  The group project is kind of intense, but it's do-able. I would recommend taking her, just be prepared to study for the essay portion of the tests!

Professor Stuart is a wealth of knowledge.  Come in respect her and your classmates and you will do fine.  She lectures all class and requires you to be a part of it.  She will guide  you to the correct answer if you say something incorrectly.  DO NOT USE "LIKE" in her class. If you are an adult, come in and do your work she is EASY.

You must participate in class and attendance is a part of your grade. The test are split up into two days. Essay on one day and multiple choice on another.  She will tell you what you need to know for the essays. The class is challenging but you will learn allot. If you are a marketing major take Randy Stuart!

Described herself as "I'm a wacko left wing liberal and proud of it" If that doesn't say RUN FROM THIS PROF then you need help. She is absurd and deserves every bit of struggle that comes in her life. She is an indecent human being and an overall pain in your butt. Transfer schools before taking her. Shes that bad. Shes not even versed in marketing

I have never received a C in any business class until now.  We literally skipped everything mathematical, went totally based on what she thought. The tests are glorified vocab tests and the essays are taking diagrams from memory to paper. I would take someone else. She couldn't even do a basic mark-up equation on the board. The class left laughing.

Classic old, bitter, single lady. Shes rude. If you make a comment during class, even if you're right, she has to correct you in some way. She can't stand to let someone say someone without correcting them. Has control or self esteems issues or something. Tests aren't terribly hard. She gives a study guide. Fairly big group project. Can't stand her

Ms. Stuart is the best professor I've had at KSU. She is a tough teacher, but you really learn in her class. I had her for mktg 3100 and was so happy to see her teach another class that I wanted. I HIGHLY recommend her!

Attendance is a must. She has a form for you to fill out every class period and you rate yourself 0-4 based on how much you participated. Don't lie, because she definitely pays attention to if you spoke up in class or not. I am and A student and got a B in the class. I almost felt as if an A were unattainable. Tests are multiple choice and essay.

I did not "think" this class was hard. I'm a straight A student and I received a B in the class. Her exams consist of multiple choice and short essays. Take good notes and review the text book. I did well on the multiple choice, but the essays kept me from ever getting an A and I have always done extremely well on essays. Choose your group wisely!

Great teacher. Knows her stuff. Have to go to class. Tests are from notes and lecture. Pay attention and participate and you should do well. 3 test, a project and participation grade. Loved this class and I would take her again!

Loved this professor. She was an overall amazing teacher, and sets up her class so yo actually learn the material. Go to class and you'll do fine. 3 tests, a project, and participation complete your grade. Take this professor!

Professor Stuart is a really good professor! I really enjoyed her class, she makes it easy to pay attention. Highly recommend coming to class and participating... it could make or break your grade. She doesn't mind embarrassing students,so don't ask stupid questions, and don't challenge her. I'll definitely take her again though!

Going into this class i was a little scared after reading the reviews here. but i experienced the complete opposite, shes kind of a meanie but the class was easy.. multiple choice and essay test with a group project. look for a good team. Overall I had a great experience.

Professor Stuart prepares you for the real world. She can come across as a jerk but she's only treating you how you will be treated. Class is interesting. Class participation is mandatory. I really enjoyed this professor!

Stuart is wonderful! I'd definitely take her again. Attendance is mandatory. She gives study guides that tell you exactly whats going to be on the tests. 3 tests are 15% each of final grade. Final is 20%. Group proj. is fun, just get started early! Easy B in the class, but if you put forth the extra effort, an A isn't unattainable.
She creates a hostile environment in class. I wouldn't recommend taking her class.

LOVED Professor Stuart! If you are immature, don't want to come to class, lack manners & want mama to hold your hand & coddle you-don't take Professor Stuart. BUT if you are there to LEARN & develop or further your interest in Marketing-then take Prof. Stuart. She is very clear on her expectations & class is easy if you pay attn & take good notes.
Good professor but she is too demanding. Getting an A is POSSIBLE, but it wont be easy. Very critical on project and attendance is graded. If you can get someone else for an easy A, go for it.

Randy is Unusual.  The material is not hard but she seems to grade at her own will and not on the information.  Some days she is realy nice and some days she tries to humilate random students for no apparnt reason. Again the material is not hard but the fairness is unpredictable and there is a lack of teaching skills

She always asks the class for input and examples. Tests are directly from the notes she gives in class. She does not post her notes on vista so go to class! She tells you exactly what to study including the 3 essay questions. One group project/presentation. Very strong personality and is one of my favorites. Definitely will take her again.

Thanks KSU for wasteing my money!I came to ksu on its rep to get an education not just a diploma.I dont belive selling purses at macys makes you a marketing professional or gives you the ability to teach me marketing. KSU please,if u are not going to give us real teachers,then just give us online without teachers i can do better with a book myself

I got an A in this class but ill be the first to say this womens behavior suggest a personality disorder possibly bi polar or something    She tends to treat peple unpredtable maye somthin hapend in her childhood. I had friends that were better students in my class but made Cs and Fs apparently bc she didnt like them and grades based on her mood

This female is borderline psycho and probly needs a medical evealuation.  The material is not hard but she gives essays so she can grade as she wants. You cant subjectivly grade multiple choice fill in blank.  She is on a power trip tries to make friends with students and totaly dispreccts others. her resume is impresive until u dig into it

She is hilarious. Show up to class, take really good notes, and study your ass off and you'll do great in her class. Her expectations are CRYSTAL clear, and her exam reviews are excellent. Her classes are usually interesting (I never fell asleep). She can be a bit abrasive, but I learned a LOT from her.

For the first couple weeks I really did not like her. She really started to grow on me and it ended up being my favorite class of the semester. Regardless of what people say about her "meanness", it's just her dry sense of humor. She grades very hard on her tests but if you study enough, you can get a good grade. Three essays on each test.

Although she knows the material, she is very mean and impolite.  She is not approachable at all.  She screams at you and doesn't teach everybody equally.  Plus she doesn't grade fairly.  I highly advise everybody not to take her class.
Great teacher - she's tough, but engages students in the class with an interactive teaching style, not your typical lecture.  Go to class, get a head start on your project and use the study guide!

Tests can be difficult, but she explains EVERYTHING in crystal clear detail. You have to memorize 3 charts/explanations per test along with a multiple choice portion. She is an excellent professor and is absolutely HILARIOUS. She doesn't post her slides online, so you have to go to class in order to get the information.

She is a great teacher, you will learn so much from her. That being said she is some what tough. She claims that she is a bit** on day one. She can be, but if you really want to learn this stuff. Then take her. 3 tests that she gives you study guides for. a project which is mandatory in every mktg class. Its a piece of cake really. Just take notes

Run, run, run.  Knows her stuff, but not approachable, makes you too afraid to ask questions, without embarrassing you. First time I felt the need to post a comment about a Professor, that is how much I disliked this Instructor.  The material was very interesting, I just wish  she was not so mean.

Run, run, run.  Knows her stuff, but not approachable, makes you too afraid to ask questions, without embarrassing you. First time I felt the need to post a comment about a Professor, that is how much I disliked this Instructor.  The material was very interesting, I just wish I could she was not so mean.

I enjoyed taking her class. Her tests are pretty simple as long as you come to class  and take good notes. She tells you the essay questions on the test ahead of time and she gives you a thorough study guide for all the exams. Put in the effort and you'll get an A. The end of the year project is difficult, but it's fun (if you have a good group!)
Great teacher! If you go to class, you can get an A. Tests are MC and essays, but you know what the essay questions are ahead of time. Make sure you carefully select your group for the group project.
One of those teachers who doesn't enjoy rewarding A's.  The class is interactive and she really knows the material.

Take Her !! Ms.Stuart can be pretty crazy but she knows her stuff. Attendance is mandatory, 3 tests MC, 4 essays choose 3, she gives you a study guide that has everything you need to study including the essay questions. Group project isn't too bad just get a good group be creative and you'll do fine. good marketing teacher!

This teacher is one of a kind. Her class is overall extremely interesting and I loved her teaching style. However, she is really really mean to her students and it made me never want to participate thinking she would make fun of me. Tests were long, with 3 essays for each test. There were 4 tests all semester with one project.

She was one of the worst teachers Ive ever taken. Attendance is mandatory and she demands her own idea of class participation although your effort is often not up to par. She enjoys humiliating you if your answers are wrong but also puts you down if you dont offer any suggestions at all. I made my first C in this class and was there everyday.

I do not recommend this teacher. I got a C in the class and I did not deserve the grade. There are only three tests and a semester long project. I got good grades on two of the tests and a great grade for the project but it still left me with a C. Take another teacher.

Loved her!  Attendance is mandatory b/c she does not post notes online.  There are 3 tests with a couple essay questions.  She tells you the essay questions before the test so you can prepare.  Start on the group project early and be very specific.  She made class interesting and she was funny.  I would take her again!

One of my favorite professors. If you're in college to actually learn, this is the class for you. Attendance is mandatory to get the notes. Tests are easy if you know your stuff. Project takes A LOT of time but really helps you think and work in a group.    I would recommend her and would absolutely take her again.

How do I describe Prof. Stuart? Well, she'll keep you on your toes, thats for sure. She isn't nice, polite, or understanding; yet at the end of the day, you really don't care. She knows her stuff and doesn't take crap from anyone. Tests have lots of memorization, so be ready. Take notes!! Otherwise, you'll be fine. The project is interesting too.
Great Professor!  Comes off cold hearted but deep down she cares and will teach you a lot!

AVOID LIKE THE PLAUGE. She is VERY disrespectful to students and her grading system is based on her partiality. Hard group project that requires way too much time and work. She needs to take time off from teaching and get some therapy for her power issues; its kind of sad because she needs help and her problems are hurting the students around her.
Stay away from this MEAN professor! She is not willing to help anybody. It does not seem like she enjoys/likes teaching.  She will start hating you for no reason...Very moody professor.

I have to disagree with the previous comments.  This is one of the BEST teachers I have had so far in my 3 years of experience at Kennesaw. She gets the class involved.  The lectures are not boring at all.  The tests are fair and easy if you study the notes, and she tells you the essays that will be on the test before the tests!!  TAKE HER!!

A hateful and cynical witch. Very partial. Full of complexes expressed in her attitude.  She will always emphasize her power and your dependance on her mood.You will not even know why she picked on you. Her exams have essay questions which give her a chance to deduct as many grades as she wants. No way to get a desirable grade if she doesn't like u

Stay as far away as you can. This professor has an bitterness in her soul that is unexplainable. She is not helpful at all and her goal will be to give you the lowest grade possible. She does not give you advice and when you attempt to participate in class she will make sure you are ridiculed and feeling like a fool. Partial, Revengeful, a disaster

She is a great teacher. You will learn in her class, but don't expect to like her. She WILL do anything in her power to keep you from getting an A. She's a grumpy old lady but a good professor in general.

Prof. Stuart is awesome!  No textbook!  Get in a group early and get with a good group!  Fun class...exams are to a "T" from notes.  Attendance is mandantory!  She is passionate about her job!  It was an easy A for me..!!
Can be intimidating at times, but overall an effective and fair class. Study the notes she gives you and you will do well.  I didn't purchase the text and made a B in the class

She is a very interesting teacher. But she is good. I got her on a SAT morning. She is funny, will pick on you. There is a group problem, but you also get to grade your useless team mates. Got a B, did have to work for it, but not that bad. read before class easy B, study before class, and show up easy A. she says what she thinks, so have fun.
She likes to play favorites and grades very hard on projects and doesn't give you very much feedback.She gives you the essay questions before the test so you can prepare for it.
Very hard and partial teacher

She is awesome! Her classes go so quickly, so you don't see and watch the clock.  She brought all  kinds of cookies to discuss branding one day... Tests are reasonably easy if you study. Multiple choice and 3 of 4 essays -- but she tells you what they essays are so you can prepare yourself! Professor Stuart is the best. Fun Fun Fun!

She actually makes this class interesting and worth going to. Tests are extremely easy, unless you're just stupid and don't know how to take notes. She lets you know which 3 short-answer questions are on the exam. Just memorize what you wrote on your notes because she GIVES you all the answers to those questions.

Class is sometimes a little monotonous but she is a very good teacher and tries to get you invovled. Tests have 3 essays but she tells you exactly what you need to know for them. You gotta go to every class and study to get an A but she makes the topics ineresting and give review sheets before every test. Test are fair but thorough.

Class is easy if you attend most classes. Exams are from notes. Tells in advance what will be for essay questions. The class demands extensive reading + end of term project/presentation. Do not miss any exams otherwise you have to give the comprehensive test. Overall an interesting class.

Her attendance policy sucks. She can be rude and is not very understanding! I gave her good points in clarity because there is really nothing to teach in MKTG 3100. It's a common sense BS class and I could teach that. Her tests are hard and require essays. I think Mktg professors needed to be much more laid back than her. Not recommended.
No Comments
No Comments

I love Ms. Stuart and is one of the best teachers I have ever had. She makes class really interesting and is not boring at all. She even brings treats for 2 class lectures that deal with what we are talking about. Her tests are easy b/c she gives you the essya questions and the study guide. You won't regret taking her class she is amazing

Very good professor. She's very smart and knows what she's talking about. On the exams, make sure that you write the essays exactly the way you take notes. There is also a group term project where you do a marketing mix and presentation for a product that you make up.

Great Professor, anyone who says otherwise is just wrong.  She is fair, test are on material covered in class.  Talks about current events to make things interesting.  Class is not easy, but you will learn, turn off Cellphone, and do not be late.
Her class is like the pit of hell. She is awful... unprofessional, inappropriate, antagonistic...

the best teacher I have had at KSU.  Ms. Stewart does not win this award for her warm fuzzy attitide, but for her skill at teaching.  She is a great intro into the field of marketing and she makes the class interesting.  She does not read textbook powerpoints and you don't really need to use the book.  She does have an attendance policy.
She is a good teacher and really explains everything well.  She does give a participation grade which can be bad for those who don't like to talk in class.
Very good teacher.  Tests are a little hard but she gives you all the information that you need to prepare for them.  Very clear for you when your taking notes.
she is awesome!!!
such an awesome teacher! you won't regret taking her!!
No Comments
She is a great teacher, just don't come late to class.
No Comments
Ms. Stuart is a great teacher.  I would recommend her to anyone who signs up for a marketing class.  She keeps the class and material interesting and current.
No Comments

If you decide to take randy stuart you need to be aware of a few things: 1. She will do almost anything to keep from giving you an A.  2. She is rude.  3. Her sarcasm is enough to make you want to walk into oncoming traffic.  4. Her tests are a ****.  5. Help outside the classroom is a rare event.

I had Ms. Stuart for Marketing. SHE IS A HOOT! I had an 8am class, but I enjoyed her class the most.  She is very enthusiastic and funny. TAKE HER!!!! You learn way more than just Marketing information

This lady always has a frown on her face. Looking past that she is a good teacher and you will learn things in her class.Her multiple choice questions are very tricky so be careful. As a person she needs to work on her attitude, but as a professor she is really good.

Second class I have had with her.  She is easy to get along with and keeps class interesting and up to date.  Projects in her class can be fun.  Take her for any marketing class you need if she is teaching it
Try to get someone else to teach this class. she is rude and very unprofessional.  Good Luck!!!!
Very bad attitude.  Extremely unprofessional.
She is wonderful.  Very enjoyable class.

She is absolutely wonderful! She will devote her time to helping you if you do not understand.  She also helps her students with advising. She only picks on her favorates in class. She encourages class part. and rewards you for it with part. points
Great teacher!  Makes effort to get to know each students name.  I had her for two marketing classes and would recommend her to anyone for any marketing class!
A total waste of time.  You're better off taking the CLEP exam for Principles of Marketing.

GREAT Teacher!!!  Someone recommended her to me and I am glad that they did. She works well with her students and she makes sure that you understand the material before she proceeds to the next topic. If you have to take MKTG 3100, take HER!!!!
No Comments

Although she makes fun of people, and no one is ever right but her, she is the best in the department and will teach you marketing (if you let her).  Take her if you want to learn, not get by.  She gives a study guide that is everything on the tests :)
Cynical woman
